intro: Peplis portula var. alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaved peplis, is a variant of the peplis plant characterized by its distinct leaf arrangement. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically features finely divided, alternate leaves that give it a delicate, fern-like appearance. It is native to certain regions of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
